page.title: 10ART COLLECTION (Contd)
page.content: There is an extensive collection of the 5th Earl's political predecessors including portraits of Lord Rockingham and Lord Shelburne both by{Reynolds, {Lawrence's}"William Pitt the Younger" Gladstone and{Gainsborough's}full length portrait of Admiral Rodney. He was also responsible for the extensive collection of Napoleonic portraits. On his death in 1928, the 5th Earl left seven houses full of art works: {Dalmeny,}with its Scottish and family portraits;{Barnbougle,}with its literary portraits;{Berkley Square, with its political portraits and London views;{Mentmore,}with its French and Old Master paintings;{The {Durdans}with sporting art; the{Villa {Rosebery}with its Italian art and {Rosebery}with its family portraits.The best of all these are now at Dalmeny.
